thread.title: Market Crash: Top banking stocks performances amid market fall, ET BFSI
thread.title_full: Market Crash: Top banking stocks performances amid market fall, ET BFSI

author: www.ETBFSI.com
title: Market Crash: Top banking stocks performances amid market fall, ET BFSI
text: ~Samriddhi Singh Mahar The market has seen a sharp decline on Tuesday; BSE Sensex has dropped by nearly 1064 points or 1.3% today, Nifty 50 fell to 24,336 as wellSome banks experienced a larger fall: Bank of India, Bandhan Bank, and RBL Bank saw their stock prices fall by over 3%. Meanwhile, others managed to maintain their prices or perform slightly better. Dhanlaxmi Bank, CSB Bank, and Equitas Small Finance Bank recorded gains of approximately 6.22%, 3.65%, and 0.08% in their share prices, respectively.Here's how some of the top banks performed today:HDFC Bank HDFC Bank played a part in dragging down today's market being a systematically important bank and a dominant player. India's largest private bank saw an opening and closing price of Rs. 1,856.35 and Rs. 1832.85, seeing a fall of 1.71% in price. Along with this, HDFC Bank's stock recorded a high of Rs. 1,862.25 and a low of Rs. 1,826.35.ICICI Bank ICICI Bank's stock opened at Rs. 1,345.70 and closed at Rs. 1333.10, reaching a high of Rs. 1,347.95. and seeing a low of Rs. 1326.55.This Vadodara based bank did not see a major fluctuation, with a price drop of 0.93% in their stocks. The private bank is among one of the few banks to outperform the nIfty bank index, with a weekly return of nearly 1.8%.SBI State Bank of India's stock opened at Rs 859.75 with a closing price of Rs Rs 850.2, reached a high of Rs 862.95, and recorded a low of Rs 847.15.India's largest public sector bank saw a fall in price by 1.22%.With a market capitalisation of Rs 768,365.2 crore as of Tuesday, SBI's performance is notable, highlighted by a 52-week high of Rs 912.1.Kotak Mahindra BankKotak Mahindra's stock opened at Rs 1,787.45 and a closing price of Rs. 1783.05, reached a high of Rs 1,805.90, and recorded a low of Rs 1,775.60.The bank has consistently maintained a stock price ranging from Rs. 1700 to Rs 1800 since nearly the past 3 years. It has also received the approval for acquisition of Standard Chartered Bank India's personal loan portfolio earlier in November, for Rs 4,100 crore.The private bank has maintained its price in Tuesday's crash as well with only a drop of 1.17%.Axis BankAxis Bank's stock opened at Rs 1,149.95 with a closing price of Rs 1135.95, reached a high of Rs 1,151.65, and recorded a low of Rs 1,130.50, with a price drop of 1.27%.The bank is still recovering from its drop in share price from 10th December, with the stock price closing at Rs 1,153.50 on December 10th and Rs 1,135.95 on December 17th, reflecting a drop of approximately 1.52%.
